alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:26PM EDT until July 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN SALEM AND WEST CENTRAL GLOUCESTER COUNTIES... At 525 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Swedesboro, or 10 miles east of Wilmington, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Chester, Pennsville, Carneys Point, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Woodstown, Swedesboro, Beckett, Delaware Memorial Bridge and Trainer. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 13. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
